position.marginalia_text: Adam, et prohibui ea qua[e] opus corrumpunt [id est] viragine[m] A medicis vero vocatur hoc corpus corruptum massa ptyssanaria, ex qua generatur in stomacho Chylus: et ex hoc Chylo generantur in stomacho quatuor humores, s[cilicet] Sanguis, Cholera, Phlegma, & Melancholia. et ex ijs corpus sustentatur, nutritur et regitur. Hoc idem ipsi dicunt per alia verba. Na[m] Natura primo procedit in stomacho Halbando, secundo in Epate rubificando ultimo in membris subtiliando. Accipiamus ergo terra[m] rubeam, ac cum sua Aqua mundificata in Aludel, igne et Aere mediantibus, a[e]qualiter coniungamus, vt corpus vnu[m] vivu[m], seu aqua sicca, vel fumus albus fiat per via[m] putrefactionis. Ha[e]c Aqua seu putrefactio vocata fuit initium operum: per Alphidiu[m] sic dicentem Scito fili quod intus Thesauri no[n] sunt absconditi, verum in ea servati cora[m] tuis oculis, cum domum ingredieris. Volo tame[n] tibi vna[m] clavem tribuere, qua[m] eorum signa voco: quod si ratione[m] habes, residuas tres claves scies et extrahes tua scientia ex ea. Porro ha[e]c vna clavis est Aqua sicca

marginalia.translation: Therefore, let us accept the read earth and mix it in equal parts with its purified water in an aludel after dividing it in the middle with fire and air, so that one fluid? body or dry water or white smoke is generated by means of putrefaction. This water or so-called putrefaction was the beginning of the works. Thus says Alphidius: Know, my sons, that inside the treasure there is nothing hidden, but in them they are safeguarded before your eyes, when you go home. Nevertheless, I want to grant one key to you, which I call the signs of them, because if you have the reasoning/method, you know the three remaining keys and you know how to extrapolate your science from it. Furhtermore, this one key is dry water.
